thread.title: 2016 Amgen Tour of California will finish in Sacramento
thread.title_full: 2016 Amgen Tour of California will finish in Sacramento

title: 2016 Amgen Tour of California will finish in Sacramento
text:
2016 Amgen Tour of California will finish in Sacramento Folsom hosted time trial of cycling race in 2014 UPDATED 3:59 PM PDT Oct 22, 2015 Photos Deirdre Fitzpatrick/KCRA 
The Amgen Tour of California announced Thursday morning the final stage of the prestigious cycling event will take place in Sacramento. Related Woman killed, child injured in... 
Several other Northern California cities will be participating in the race. 
The time trials, which will be Stage 6 of the cycling tour, will be held in Folsom on May 20. 
The day before in Stage 5, riders will go from Lodi to South Lake Tahoe. 
The entire tour will begin in San Diego on May 15. The race will then head up the coast to South Pasadena, Santa Clarita, Thousand Oaks and Santa Barbara County. From there, riders will cycle from Morro Bay to Monterey County in Stage 4. 
Just before the finish on May 22 in Sacramento, cyclists will head to Santa Rosa for Stage 7. 
The city of Folsom, along with Sacramento city officials, touted a big announcement Thursday morning, but would not give any hints ahead of the press conference. 
"Folsom has been a leader in the bicycle community for years and years and years," Folsom Vice Mayor Steve Miklos. "The announcement is going to be very exciting, not only for the region, but for the state as well, because it is going to put another city's mark on that event." 
Folsom hosted the time trial event, which was Stage 2 of the tour in 2014. It was an all-day event that put the city on the map. 
"We got tremendous worldwide exposure, and actually, there is an international company relocating from Ireland to Folsom, and that was a direct contact from seeing us on Amgen that year," Miklos said. 
The city is known for its miles of bike trails and large cycling community, but many of those people attending the 2014 Tour of California commented on Folsom's unique landscape. 
"This is a beautiful area. So I think everybody in this region can be proud of what we showcased in 2014," Miklos said. Tweet
